poffi_article.lead_et: Esimest korda saab Pimedate Ööde filmifestivali külastada igas Eestimaa nurgas, kuhu ulatub internet.
poffi_article.lead_ru: Впервые кинофестиваль «Тёмные ночи» (PÖFF) можно будет посетить в любом уголке Эстонии, где есть интернет.
poffi_article.lead_en: Tallinn Black Nights Film Festival holds physical and virtual screenings while the international industry and press will be granted virtual access to films and events regardless of their location.
poffi_article.contents_et:
Tänavu 13.–29. novembrini toimuv festival leiab aset kombineeritud kujul – filme saab vaadata nii kinodes kui virtuaalselt. 

Kinosaalid avatakse endiselt Tallinnas ja Tartus, samuti Ida-Virumaal, kus toimub PÖFFi kõrvalfestival Kinoff. Virtuaalne programm jõuab vaatajani maailma üheks turvalisemaks peetava veebiplatvormi Shift72 vahendusel, mida on kasutanud ka Cannes´i, Kopenhaageni ja Melbourne´i filmifestival. 

„Me teeme kõik, mis meie võimuses, et filmid linastuksid seal, kus on nende õige koht – suurel ekraanil, ja siia tuleks nii palju filmitegijaid kui võimalik, aga viimane sõna on öelda koroonaviirusel ja terviseametil – järgime juhtnööre väga täpselt,” ütles PÖFFi juht Tiina Lokk. 

Festival rakendab kõiki ohutusreegleid, sealhulgas varustatakse seanssidele tulijad tasuta maskidega. 

Programmi esimesed filmid avalikustab PÖFF septembri teises pooles. Debüütfilmide võistlusprogrammi piletite eelmüük algab 16. oktoobril, põhivõistlusprogrammi piletite eelmüük 23. oktoobril. Kogu programmi pileteid saab osta 6. novembrist. 

Pimedate Ööde filmifestival leiab aset 24. korda. Festivali esitlevad Elisa, Nordic Hotel Forum ja Toyota.
poffi_article.contents_en:
The 24th edition of Black Nights Film Festival is hybrid; ensuring the most safety for our local and foreign guests. You will find an overlook of all the measures and virtual possibilities at this year's festival below.

**Accredited press and industry**
Since foreign travel to Estonia is restricted, accredited foreign press and industry delegates will be granted access to the festival’s programme digitally via the Shift72 platform, no matter their geographic location. The industry strand, Industry@Tallinn & Baltic Event [has moved fully online this year](https://poff.ee/en/news/industry-tallinn-and-baltic-event-happens-fully-online-this-year-1/), using the Elisa Stage platform. 

**Foreign travel**
Travel of foreign filmmakers and the press is subject to strict health and safety regulations and the [cooperation with three medical companies](https://poff.ee/en/news/safety-first-p-oe-ff-collaborates-with-three-medical-companies/). Read about safety for foreign guests [here](https://poff.ee/en/about/safety-for-foreign-guests/).

**Physical screenings**
The [physical screenings](https://poff.ee/en/search_screening/), however, have not been cancelled. Extra safety measures do apply and wearing masks to all events is obligatory. As the festival has always hosted several hundred filmmakers to present their films every year, some might be forced to do so virtually this year. For this reason, the festival is preparing virtual video greeting and Q&A formats that would precede the film screenings. The number of films to be screened is lower than in previous editions.

**Virtual screenings**
For the first time in the festival’s history viewers based in Estonia can now watch films from your home, at the time that suits best suits you. Read more on how to [watch the best of PÖFF at home](https://poff.ee/en/news/how-do-i-watch-the-best-of-p-oe-ff-at-home/)

[APPLY FOR THE INDUSTRY ACCREDITATION! ](https://industry.poff.ee/accreditation-2-2/)
[APPLY FOR THE PRESS ACCREDITATION!](https://vp.eventival.com/poff/24th)
poffi_article.contents_ru:
Кинозалы откроют свои двери по-прежнему в Таллинне и Тарту, а также в Ида-Вирумаа в рамках KinoFF – фестиваля-спутника PÖFF. Онлайн-показы будут доступны зрителям на одной из самых безопасных платформ Shift72, которую используют и кинофестивали в Каннах, Копенгагене и Мельбурне.

«Мы делаем всё, что в наших силах, чтобы фильмы были показаны, как и положено, на большим экранах, и к нам приехало как можно больше создателей кино, однако последнее слово останется за коронавирусом и департаментом здоровья. Мы будем выполнять все предписания в точности», – сказала директор PÖFF Тийна Локк.

Фестиваль будет соблюдать все меры предосторожности, в том числе выдаст всем посетителям бесплатные маски.

Фестиваль опубликует первые фильмы во второй половине сентября. Билеты на фильмы из конкурсной программы дебютных фильмов поступят в предварительную продажу 16 октября, а из основной конкурсной программы – 23 октября. Продажа на все фильмы фестиваля откроется 6 ноября.

Таллиннский кинофестиваль «Тёмные ночи» пройдет в 24-й раз. Главные спонсоры фестиваля – Elisa, Nordic Hotel Forum ja Toyota.

poffi_article.contents_et:
PÖFF toimub tänavu 13.–29. novembrini Tallinnas ja Tartus, lisaks leiab 13.–15. novembrini Kohtla-Järvel, 20.–22. novembrini Narvas ja 27.–29. novembrini Jõhvis aset PÖFFi kõrvalfestival KinoFF.  Suur osa festivali programmist on kättesaadav ka virtuaalselt. Industry@Tallinn & Baltic Event üritused on kavas 23.–27. novembrini ainult virtuaalselt.

Akrediteering võimaldab külastada kõiki PÖFFi seansse ja pressiüritusi nii kinosaalis kui veebis, samuti kõiki Industry@Tallinn & Baltic Event avalikke üritusi Elisa Stage platvormi vahendusel. Eraldi pressiseansse tänavu ei toimu. 

Akrediteeringu hind on 15 eurot. 

Ootame akrediteeruma kõiki ajakirjanikke, kriitikuid, tele- ja raadioreportereid, fotograafe, aga ka blogijaid, mõjuisikuid ja teisi sotsiaalmeedias tegutsevaid sisuloojaid. Festival väljastab akrediteeringu varasema kajastuse, tänavuse kajastusplaani ja muude kriteeriumide järgi.

[TAOTLE SIIN!](https://vp.eventival.com/poff/24th)


## JUHISED PÖFFI VEEBIKESKONDADE KASUTAMISEKS 

Pimedate Ööde Filmifestival ja Industry@Tallinn & Baltic Event on astunud uude ajastusse ja toimuvad üritused leiavad aset ka virtuaalruumis: festivali filmiprogramm linastub nii kinodes kui virtuaalkeskkonnas, Industry@Tallinn & Baltic Event üritused leiavad täies mahus aset veebis.   
  

### PRESSIAKREDITEERING VÕIMALDAB


- Osaleda kõigil Industry@Tallinn & Baltic Event avatud üritustel veebilehel industry.poff.ee (täpsemad juhised allpool). 
- Vaadata festivalil linastuvaid filme virtuaalplatvormil [**proscreen.poff.ee**](proscreen.poff.ee).  
- Lunastada pileteid festivali kinoseanssidele. 

**NB!**
 
- Ajakirjanikud saavad filme vaadata lehel [**proscreen.poff.ee**](proscreen.poff.ee), mitte festivali tavavaatajatele mõeldud lehel kino.poff.ee 
- Tänavu ei kehti ajalised piirangud füüsiliste kinoseansside piletite lunastamisel – saate kõik piletid korraga varakult välja võtta. 
 

### KUIDAS VAADATA FILME? 


- Festival loob kõigile akrediteeritud külalistele kasutajakonto proscreen.poff.ee veebilehele, palun kinnitage emaili teel saadetud kutse ja looge endale kasutajakonto;. 
- Logige sisse lehel [proscreen.poff.ee](proscreen.poff.ee) kasutades Edge (PC) või Safari (Mac) veebilehitsejaid. 
- Leidke film mida soovite vaadata ja valige subtiitrid. 

**NB!**

- Tehniliste probleemide korral palun pöörduge festivalassistant@poff.ee.  
- Kahjuks ei saa proscreen.poff.ee veebilehele siseneda Google Chrome’i, Firefox’i ja Opera’ga, sest nende lehitsejatega seotud süsteemides on leitud turvaaugud, mille parandamisega tegeleb Google hetkel tegeleb. PÖFFile on filmivaldkonna väärtuste ja huvide kaitsmine väga oluline ja tekkinud olukorras peame me filmitegijate huvide kaitsmiseks näitama filme ainult nendes brauserites, kus saame tagada filmi turvalise edastamise. 
- Juhime teie tähelepanu, et mitte kogu festivali programm pole veebiplatvormil kättesaadav. Filmide olemasolu veebiplatvormil sõltub filmitegijatega sõlmitud kokkulepetest. Huvi korral saame teile kontakte vahendada, et saaksite filmide õiguste omajalt otse vaatamisõigust taotleda. 
- Filmid on vaadatavad pärast filmi esimest kinolinastust. 
- Filmid on vaadatavad teatud ajaperioodi jooksul, vastav info on nähtav filmi juures.  
- Filmi subtiitreid saab valida paremal all asuvale ikoonile klikkides. 
- Kõikidel filmidel ei ole subtiitreid. 


### KUIDAS OSALEDA Industry@Tallinn & Baltic Event AVATUD ÜRITUSTEL? 

- Industry@Tallinn avatud üritustel saate osaleda veebilehel industry.poff.ee, sisse saate logida alates 16. novembrist kasutades oma Eventivalis loodud kasutajakontole sisselogimiseks kasutatavat meiliaadressi. 
- Üritustel osalemiseks logige oma kasutajakontoga industry.poff.ee lehele ja klõpsake huvipakkuvale üritusele. 
- Küsimuste ja murede korral pöörduge info.industry@poff.ee. 

### PÜSIGE PÖFFI LAINEL
[**Facebook**](https://www.facebook.com/tallinnblacknightsff )
[**Instagram**](https://www.instagram.com/tallinnblacknightsff/ )
[**Twitter**](https://twitter.com/TallinnBNFF )
**Vialog**: tänavu toimuvad Q&A sessioonid filmitegijatega ka virtuaalselt PÖFFi kodulehel. Valige huvipakkuv film ja esitage vastava filmi juures küsimus otse filmitegijale (küsimus sisestage Vialogi lahtrisse). 

### MEIE HASHTAGID
#Tallinnblacknightsfilmfestival #PÖFF24
poffi_article.contents_en:
#### Press Accreditation

The media accreditation to the 24th Tallinn Black Nights Film Festival aka PÖFF and the audiovisual industry platform Industry@Tallinn & Baltic Event is open. The physical festival takes place from the 13th to the 29th of November in Tallinn and Tartu, Estonia, while the industry events will happen only online this year.

The accredited foreign press will be granted access to the festival’s programme and industry programme digitally via the Shift72 platform, no matter their geographic location, during the festival time. The platform can be found at [proscreen.poff.ee](proscreen.poff.ee), not to be confused with the festival's audience-directed page kino.poff.ee.

The PRESS accreditation will give you access to any PÖFF or sub-festival screenings, press events and all of the open industry events. The physical press screenings will not take place this year. The accreditation fee is **15 EUR**, valid before and during the festival. 

[APPLY HERE](https://vp.eventival.com/poff/24th)

**Information for press who is hosted and/or who's travel is arranged by the festival:**
Due to likely travel restrictions caused by the resurgence of the COVID-19 pandemic, the travel of foreign filmmakers and the press will be decided upon according to the situation in late October depending on whether Estonia’s COVID restrictions allow for movement from the country of their current residency or not. It is very likely that countries in the Schengen area will be less affected. The festival has partnered with medical companies SYNLAB and Medicum and is currently preparing a protocol of pre-testing via mail to ensure that more people will be able to attend the events without the quarantine requirement.
 
You can read more about Estonia's current travel regulations for foreigners [here](https://www.kriis.ee/en/travelling-estonia-foreigners).

#### PRO Accrediation

To attend Industry@Tallinn & Baltic Event 2020 online during November 23-27 and virtually see the films selected at the Tallinn Black Nights Film Festival you will need to apply for Industry PRO accreditation.

**[Industry PRO accreditation](https://industry.poff.ee/accreditation-2-2/)** is reserved exclusively for film industry professionals, and grants access to Industry@Tallinn & Baltic Event online programme, plus online screenings from Tallinn Black Nights Film Festival’s (BNFF) various competition programmes. Accreditation is valid from November 13, 2020.  

When accredited as **Industry PRO**, you are invited to:  

Watch a large selection of films in the programme of Black Nights;
Actively participate in Industry@Tallinn & Baltic Event online programme – all-embracing online programme focusing on finding new paths, inspiration and tools in a rapidly changing film industry, and building ties between film professionals in North-Eastern Europe, CIS, US and Asia. 

PRICE for the Industry PRO accreditation – 45 EUR 

 [FIND OUT MORE AND APPLY](https://industry.poff.ee/accreditation-2-2/)


#### INSTRUCTIONS HOW TO ATTEND THE VIRTUAL INDUSTRY EVENTS AND WATCH FILMS DURING PÖFF24  

Tallinn Black Nights Film Festival and Industry@Tallinn & Baltic Event have entered a new era this year by becoming a hybrid event: the festival’s programme will be screened both in cinemas and virtually, while all the industry events will be held online. Here is a virtual guide how to navigate these events.  

  

#### WHAT CAN YOU DO WITH YOUR PRESS ACCREDITATION

-  Attend all the open industry events at industry.poff.ee (you can find the instructions below)  
- Watch films on the festival’s online platform for professionals on proscreen.poff.ee.  
- Redeem tickets to the festival's physical screenings. 

**NB!** Please note that the press badge enables you to watch films only on the [proscreen.poff.ee](proscreen.poff.ee) platform, not to be confused with the festival's audience-directed page kino.poff.ee.


#### HOW TO ATTEND VIRTUAL INDUSTRY EVENTS?

- Industry open events are available for attending at industry.poff.ee with Eventival account used to apply for accreditation. ENTER VISITOR PAGE (login e-mail maria.suurvali@poff.ee)  
- From November 16 you can sign into at industry.poff.ee with Eventival account, check the programme and add events to the calendar. Until then, please check the programme here.    
- For attending the events just sign at industry.poff.ee, select the upcoming event from the programme and enjoy! 
- If you need any help, please write to info.industry@poff.ee. 
  

#### HOW TO WATCH FILMS? 

- The festival send all accredited professionals an invitation to proscreen.poff.com. Please accept the invitation and create yourself a user on the page.  
- Log in at proscreen.poff.ee using Edge (PC) or Safari (Mac) browsers  
-  Find the film you want to watch and enjoy!  

#### NB!
- Please write to festivalassistant@poff.ee if You need any help.  
- Due to security reasons recently found in Google's backend systems, currently only the following browsers can be used to watch films on the festivals web platforms proscreen.poff.ee and kino.poff.ee: EDGE (PC) and Safari (Mac). This is to protect the interests of the films rights holders and filmmakers.  
- Please note that the whole programme is not available on the site as the availability of the films depends on what particular films the film makers have decided to make available to professionals. The availability is different for press and industry accreditation holders.  
- Films are available for watching only after the first public screening has taken place in the cinema.   
- The films are available only for a restricted period and you will see the info once the date is approaching.   
- You can choose subtitles in the playback window, but please note that not all of the films have that option.  
- Please note that Industry ACCESS accreditation does not include the option to watch films at festival’s online platform 


#### TUNE IN
[**Instagram**](https://www.instagram.com/tallinnblacknightsff/)
[**Facebook**](https://www.facebook.com/tallinnblacknightsff)
[**Twitter**](https://twitter.com/TallinnBNFF )
**Vialog**: interact with our filmmakers via videos you can leave on the profile page of every film on our webpage. Scroll down on the page and find the Vialog chatbox. 

OUR HASHTAGS 
#Tallinnblacknightsfilmfestival #PÖFF24
poffi_article.contents_ru:
Аккредитация СМИ на 24-й Таллиннский кинофестиваль «Тёмные ночи» (PÖFF) и кинорынок Industry@Tallinn & Baltic Event открыта! Физически фестиваль пройдет с 13 по 29 ноября 2020 года в Таллинне и Тарту (Эстония), однако кинорынок пройдет [только онлайн](https://poff.ee/ru/novost/kinorynok-tallinnskogo-kinofestivalya-tyomnye-nochi-projdet-onlajn/).

Субфестиваль детского и молодёжного кино Just Film пройдет с 13 по 29 ноября, и субфестиваль короткометражного и анимационного кино PÖFF Shorts – с 17 по 25 ноября.

Фестиваль-спутник KinoFF, посвященный современному российскому кинематографу, пройдет в Кохтла-Ярве с 13 по 15 ноября, в Нарве с 20 по 22 ноября и в Йыхви с 27 по 29 ноября.

На этот период аккредитованные представители зарубежной прессы независимо от их географического местонахождения получат доступ к программе фестиваля и кинорынка онлайн на платформе Shift72.

Аккредитация дает доступ ко всем кинопоказам PÖFF и его сопутствующим фестивалям, мероприятиям для прессы и открытым мероприятиям кинорынка. Стоимость аккредитации составляет 15 евро и действует до и в течение всего фестиваля.

Отдельные пресс-показы в этом году проводиться не будут.

Мы приглашаем пройти аккредитацию всех журналистов, критиков, теле- и радиорепортеров, а также блогеров и инфлюэнсеров. Основанием для выдачи аккредитации являются прежние публикации и план публикаций на этот год.

Информация для представителей СМИ, которые планируют приехать на место и/или чью поездку организует фестиваль:
Из-за ограничений на передвижение между странами из-за COVID-19, которые с большой долей вероятности будут действовать во время фестиваля, решение о приезде иностранных кинодеятелей и прессы будет выносится согласно ситуации в конце октября в соответствии с правилами, установленными в отношении страны их местонахождения. Вероятно, страны Шенгенской зоны эти ограничения затронут в меньшей степени. Партнеры фестиваля SYNLAB и Medicum сейчас подготавливают порядок предварительного тестирования, чтобы как можно больше желающих смогли посетить мероприятия без необходимости соблюдать карантин.
 
Вы можете узнать подробнее о действующих сейчас в Эстонии ограничениях на пересечение границы здесь.

[ПОДАТЬ ЗАЯВКУ НА АККРЕДИТАЦИЮ](https://vp.eventival.com/poff/24th)

poffi_article.contents_et:
Põhjuseks on tõenäoliselt ka sügisel kehtivad reisimisega seotud piirangud, mis ei luba suurel osal külalistest Tallinna tulla või seovad siia saabumise liikumisvabaduse kärpimisega.

„Teeme seda raske südamega, aga me ei taha võtta riske,” ütles ürituse juht Marge Liiske. Vastava otsuseni jõuti pärast konsulteerimist terviseametnikega, kelle prognoos ei ennusta sügiseks viiruse vaibumist.

Veebi kolimine annab Liiske sõnul samas võimaluse üritust laiendada ja avab ukse neile, kes ei saaks muidu ajapuudusel või kauguse tõttu Tallinna tulla. Ühtlasi on see hea võimalus katsetada uuenduslikke digitaalseid lahendusi.

Endiselt jätkub valmivate või kavandatavate filmiprojektide vastuvõtt Baltic Evendi kaastootmisturule, filmi- ja telesarjade stsenaariumite võistlusele Script Pool ning Põhja- ja Baltimaade stsenaristide projektitutvustuste foorumile POWR Baltic Stories Exchange. Vastuvõtt lõpeb 21. septembril.

Ürituse delegaatidele ja akrediteeritud välispressile garanteeritakse ligipääs üritustele ja Pimedate Ööde filmifestivali kavas olevatele filmidele.

Industry@Tallinn & Baltic Evendi programmi kuuluvad veel seminarid, õpikojad, meistriklassid ja vestlusringid, mis käsitlevad filmitööstuse ja teleturu aktuaalseid teemasid. Samuti leiab esimest korda aset PÖFFi Akadeemia, kus saavad end täiendada filmindusega seotud erialade esindajad alates näitlejatest ja lõpetades heliloojatega.

Programmi esimesed üritused ja esinejad avalikustab Industry@Tallinn & Baltic Event septembris.

Pimedate Ööde filmifestival leiab tänavu aset 13.–29. novembrini. Koroonaviiruse levikust tulenevalt on ette valmistamisel mitu võimalikku stsenaariumit, sealhulgas toimumist hübriidfestivalina või halvimal juhul tervenisti virtuaalsel kujul.
poffi_article.contents_en:
Industry@Tallinn & Baltic Event, the industry strand of the Tallinn Black Nights Film Festival has decided to move online completely due to likely travel restrictions caused by the resurgence of COVID-19.

The preparations for the 24th edition of the Tallinn Black Nights Film Festival include the readiness to provide global industry and press access for the films and events, while preparations for holding a physical event are still underway.
 
Following the first signs of the possible resurgence of COVID-19 in the country, the organisers of the festival and its affiliated industry event have followed the predictions of the Health Board of Estonia and made the decision to move the industry programs online, while continuing to accept project submissions. The global film industry representatives will still be able to apply for access to all events, project pitches and films regardless of their geographical location.

Marge Liiske, Head of Industry@Tallinn & Baltic Event commented: „Following the discussions with Estonia’s health officials, it seems more than likely that there will be another outbreak in one form or another and that foreign travel will either be blocked or with restrictions. This would not enable for our guests to attend the events properly and thus, with a heavy heart, we have decided from early on to not to take any risks and move all our activities online this year.”

“Having said that, I believe that moving online also presents us with some new opportunities and also for the audience – we hope that even more film industry professionals than before are able to benefit from our program, as they do not have to travel to Tallinn to attend the events and they can access the content from anywhere at their best convenience. Also, while preparing the programme we can play around with different engaging digital formats and involve speakers, who would not be able to visit us in Tallinn,” Liiske added.

The team is currently busy working on the programme and the first speakers will be announced in September. The programme will include seminars, workshops, masterclasses, panel discussions, as usual, covering the most burning topics of film and TV market as well as PÖFF Academy events directed towards actors, scouting agents, film music composers, costume designers and set photographers. 

Currently, submissions are open for Baltic Event Co-production Market (projects seeking co-producers, financiers and sales agents), Script Pool Tallinn (film and series scripts worldwide competition) and POWR Baltic Stories Exchange (Nordic and Baltic scriptwriters seeking producers). The deadline for submitting the projects is September, 21 and the evaluation of the projects is carried out online. Everyone who has submitted the project has access to Industry @Tallinn & Baltic event online-program including workshops, masterclasses, panel discussions, meetings with industry professionals, etc. 
 
The programme will be announced in various stages throughout September and October.

Black Nights Film Festival is making preparations for several scenarios.
 
Since the first COVID-19-related lockdown in spring, Black Nights has been preparing for several possible scenarios, getting ready to take place physically while also upgrading the digital infrastructure that would enable to organise a hybrid or even a completely digital event. It looks likely that foreign travel to Estonia will be restricted, thus accredited foreign press and industry delegates will be granted access to the festival’s programme digitally via the Shift72 platform, no matter their geographic location. Travel of foreign filmmakers and the press will be decided upon according to the situation in October and November, depending on whether Estonia’s COVID restrictions allow movement from the country of their current residency or not.

The physical screenings, however, have not been cancelled, as the Health Board of Estonia currently remains optimistic that the complete lockdown of cinemas can be avoided this time around. As the festival has always hosted several hundred filmmakers to present their films every year, some might be forced to do so virtually this year. For this reason, the festival is preparing virtual video greeting and Q&A formats that would precede the film screenings. There is also a high probability that the festival will cut back on the size of its programme this year.

Tiina Lokk, the director and head of the programme of Black Nights commented: “Our off-season side events, the Haapsalu Horror Film Festival we organised completely online during the lockdown this spring, and the Tartu Love Film Festival which is currently taking place as a hybrid event, have provided us with the valuable experience of organising virtual screenings and Q&As and combining them with a physical event. We are doing everything in our power to hold physical screenings and bring over as many foreign guests as possible, but the virus and Estonia’s Health Board will have the final say in these matters.” 

The festival’s plans for digital development goes further than this though, including plans to build, over the course of the next couple of years, a unique online environment that caters the festival’s needs in terms of organising public and closed screenings, conferences and an extensive online industry platform that includes a market place, virtual meeting and pitching rooms and a year-around project market to connect projects at all stages of their cycle with respective parties of interest – financiers, producers, distributors etc.
 
Another important aspect will be the year-around promotion of Estonia as a location for production and recruiting talent, including the introduction of locations of interest, a database of the country’s professionals, exhibiting the services they provide and the content they have produced. Estonia’s first two regional film funds – the Viru Film Fund and the Tartu Film Fund – will be in charge of keeping the locations and talent pools up to date.
 
The third fundamental element of the new platform is education, that will see the launch of PÖFF Academy aiming to provide high-quality audiovisual education with partners at the Estonian Film Institute, the Baltic Film, Media, Art and Communication School and the Pallas University of Applied Sciences. This will be based on the structure that has been laid out by the Creative Gate project, organised by the Industry@Tallinn & Baltic Event team, that has been holding events directed towards actors, scouting agents, film music composers, costume designers and set photographers over the last three years, and which added the European Film Academy Masterclasses into the mix last year.
 
Festival director Tiina Lokk commented:  „Some of the changes that are being prepared will actually rewire the festival’s DNA, making it more digital, networked, ubiquitous and inclusive than ever before! But first and foremost, we are hoping to make the physical festival still happen this year!” she added.

The 24th Tallinn Black Nights Film Festival will run from the 13th until the 29th of November.
Industry@Tallinn & Baltic Event will run from the 23rd until the 27th of November.

После появления первых признаков возможной второй волны COVID-19 в стране организаторы учли прогнозы Департамента здоровья Эстонии и приняли решение перевести программу кинорынка в онлайн-режим, продолжив принимать проектные заявки. Представители мировой киноиндустрии по-прежнему смогут подавать заявки на получение доступа ко всем мероприятиям, презентациям проектов и фильмам независимо от их географического положения.

«По итогам консультаций с представителями здравоохранения Эстонии представляется более чем вероятным, что в той или иной форме произойдет еще одна вспышка заболеваемости и что будет наложен запрет на зарубежные поездки либо введены ограничения. Это не позволило бы нашим гостям должным образом посещать мероприятия, и поэтому с тяжелым сердцем мы заблаговременно решили не рисковать и перенести в этом году все наши мероприятия в виртуальную среду», - прокомментировала директор Industry@Tallinn & Baltic Event Марге Лийске.

«Я считаю, что переезд в Интернет также создаст для нас и для аудитории некоторые новые возможности: мы надеемся, что из нашей программы смогут извлечь пользу даже больше профессионалов киноиндустрии, чем раньше, поскольку им не нужно будет ехать в Таллинн и они смогут получить доступ к контенту из любой удобной для них географической точки. Кроме того, при подготовке программы мы можем поиграть с различными привлекательными цифровыми форматами и привлечь докладчиков, которые не смогли бы посетить нас в Таллинне», - добавила Лийске.

В настоящее время команда работает над программой, и первые докладчики будут объявлены в сентябре. Программа включит в себя, как обычно, семинары, мастерские, мастер-классы, панельные дискуссии, которые покроют все самые животрепещущие темы, а также пройдут мероприятия Академии PÖFF, ориентированные на актеров, агентов, кинокомпозиторов, художников по костюмам и фотографов-декораторов. 

В настоящее время открыт прием заявок на участие в Baltic Event Co-production Market (проекты для сопродюсеров, инвесторов и торговых агентов), Script Pool Tallinn (всемирный конкурс сценариев фильмов и сериалов) и POWR Baltic Stories Exchange (для сценаристов из стран Северной Европы и Балтии, ищущих продюсеров). Срок подачи проектов – 21 сентября, и их оценивание проводится онлайн. Каждый участник, приславший проект, будет иметь доступ к онлайн-программе мероприятий Industry@Tallinn & Baltic Event, включающей семинары, мастер-классы, панельные дискуссии, встречи с профессионалами киноиндустрии и т. д. 

В этом году впервые будет организована Академия PÖFF, целью которой является предоставление высококачественного аудиовизуального образования.

Industry@Tallinn & Baltic Event пройдет с 23 по 27 ноября 2020, и его программа будет объявлена поэтапно в течение сентября и октября.

Таллиннский кинофестиваль «Тёмные ночи» пройдет в этом году с 13 по 29 ноября. Из-за распространения коронавируса организаторы готовятся к нескольким возможным сценариям, включая традиционную организацию на месте и готовность в случае необходимости провести мероприятия самого фестиваля частично или полностью онлайн.

Аккредитованные иностранные представители прессы и профессионалы киноиндустрии получат доступ к программе фестиваля в цифровом виде на платформе Shift72, независимо от их географического положения.
